trait.name: Colony Resistance
entries: The coelenite has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that target only it.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The coelenite can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if the coelenite has half of its hit points or fewer. A target hit by the attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The coelenite has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

A coelenite (pronounced {@i SEE-len-ite}) is a roughly humanoid coral-like creature made of hundreds of thousands of tiny organisms no larger than a pebble. The tiny creatures that make up a coelenite are brightly coloured and amorphous, but when they group together in a colony they harden like coral and take on a more structured form. These bodies have crushing claws akin to those of a giant crab and almost impenetrable armour. In addition, their colonial nature makes them resistant a wide variety of spells and conditions.

entries.name: Water Dependant
entries: Despite their tough exoskeleton, the interior of a coelenite colony is amorphous and mushy. This interior requires a near constant supply of water to remain hydrated. Many sailors claim that the easiest way to kill a coelenite is to lure it inside a cabin and lock it in overnight.

entries.name: Mass Minds
entries: Should enough coelenites come together, they can produce an intelligence above that of a regular colony. These mass minds are capable of commanding other coelenite colonies and even manifesting magical effects. Luckily, if enough of the organisms that form the mass mind are killed, it loses these cognitive qualities.

trait.name: Colony Resistance
entries: The coelenite has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that target only it.

trait.name: Colony Resistance
entries: If the coelenite has half its hit points or fewer its Intelligence score drops to 5 (-3), it can't use its Innate Spellcasting, Limited Telepathy, or Psychic Crush.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The coelenite can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The coelenite can magically tarnsmit simple messages and images to any creature within 60 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond unless that creature is a coelenite.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The coelenite's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if the coelenite has half of its hit points or fewer. A target hit by the attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). The coelenite has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Psychic Crush {@recharge 5}
entries: The coelenite targets one creature that it can sense within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A coelenite (pronounced {@i SEE-len-ite}) is a roughly humanoid coral-like creature made of hundreds of thousands of tiny organisms no larger than a pebble. The tiny creatures that make up a coelenite are brightly coloured and amorphous, but when they group together in a colony they harden like coral and take on a more structured form. These bodies have crushing claws akin to those of a giant crab and almost impenetrable armour. In addition, their colonial nature makes them resistant a wide variety of spells and conditions.

entries.name: Water Dependant
entries: Despite their tough exoskeleton, the interior of a coelenite colony is amorphous and mushy. This interior requires a near constant supply of water to remain hydrated. Many sailors claim that the easiest way to kill a coelenite is to lure it inside a cabin and lock it in overnight.

entries.name: Mass Minds
entries: Should enough coelenites come together, they can produce an intelligence above that of a regular colony. These mass minds are capable of commanding other coelenite colonies and even manifesting magical effects. Luckily, if enough of the organisms that form the mass mind are killed, it loses these cognitive qualities.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The octopus has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while underwater.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The octopus makes four tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the grapple ends, the octopus can't use this tentacle on another target. The octopus has eight tentacles.

action.name: Tentacle Slam
entries: The octopus slams creatures {@condition grappled} by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the octopus' next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A 30-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the octopus if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the octopus can use the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.

Larger even than the {@creature giant octopus}, a colossal octopus grows to the size of a fishing boat and lives in the darkest depths of the ocean. Many colossal octopi serve as the emissaries of krakens, exploring waters beyond the territory of the master and reporting back. It's said that a colossal octopus can pull the mast out of a ship from beneath the hull, but that seeing on and survival is a blessing from the gods.

entries.name: Ship Sinkers
entries: Colossal octopi are renowned for sinking even large ships, using their powerful tentacles to tear apart hulls, rip siege weaponry from their bases, and fling crew members across the deck with ease. Sailors typically utter prayers to {@deity Umberlee|Faerûnian|scag} or other gods of the ocean to protect them from the beasts while out at sea.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The eye of the deep can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Baleful Flash
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the eye of the deep must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
This feature doesn't function while the eye of the deep is maintaining concentration on a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eye of the deep's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eye of the deep makes two pincer attacks. If the eye of the deep is grappling a creature, the eye of the deep can also use its bite once.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the eye of the deep doesn't have two other creatures {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The eye of the deep shots one of the following magical eye rays, which have a range of 60 feet:

items.name: Holding Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Freezing Blast.
items.entry: Each creature in a cone must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: An eye of the deep is an aquatic version of the more infamous land-based beholder. These monsters dwell in the deepest reaches of the oceans, but rise to the surface to menace those who dwell above the waves. These hateful and cruel creatures are fond of creating illusions of shipwreck survivors, small islands, mermaids, or whatever else they think might lure their victims closer. Some eyes of the deep can be found in relatively shallow waterways far underground.

entries.name: Sunken Lairs
entries: Eyes of the deep typically lair in undersea caves, shipwrecks, or coral mazes. Unlike a true beholder, eyes of the deep have a limited ability to alter their environs as they lack the disintegration eye ray. Because of this, eyes of the deep often search for new, larger lairs as they grow as a hermit crab searches for ever larger shells. When a suitable lair is found, an eye of the deep bedecks it with a certain treasure they find appealing; gemstones, jewellery, statuary or the like.

entries.name: Tricky Illusionists
entries: The central eye of an eye of the deep is capable of producing an impressively realistic illusion to lure prey to its lair. When close enough, the eye of the deep swaps from using the illusory magic to a bright flash capable of blinding its prey. The eye of the deep can then paralyse the target, and close in for the kill.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the graven image remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statuette.

trait.name: Foment Madness
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the graven image must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, or it hears a faint buzzing in hits head for a moment and then has disadvantage on its next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

If the saving throw against Foment Madness fails by 5 or more, the creature is instead subjected to the {@spell confusion} spell for 1 minute (no concentration required by the graven image). While under the effect of that {@spell confusion}, the creature is immune to Foment Madness.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The graven image is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The graven image has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The graven image's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eye of the deep makes two demoralising beam attacks.

action.name: Demoralising Beam
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) force damage. If the target is a humanoid, its Charisma score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if this reduces its Charisma to 0.

action.name: Gaseous Curse {@recharge 5}
entries: The graven image targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, or become cursed. While cursed, the target transforms, along with everything it is wearing or carrying, into a misty cloud.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strenth, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't attack or cast spells.
The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic.

Some of the darkest cults in the world have devised a way to sculpt idols in the image of Elder Evils and Far Realm deities. These idols, if fashioned correctly, can act as conduits for these beings on the Material Plane. A graven idol is typically made of semi-precious stone such as jet or jade and has hideous abilities that are terrifying to witness.

entries.name: Ritual Made
entries: Each graven image must be fashioned over a period of months by one who has seen into the beyond, and gained the knowledge of the form of an Elder Evil or similar entity. The holder of this knowledge must then sculpt the form from precious material, and birth it into the world in a ritual which typically requires human sacrifice.

entries.name: Otherworldly Powers
entries: A graven image has several unique abilities that make it terrifying to encounter. Their very nature is madness-inducing, causing even the staunchest warriors to fumble and lose their way. They can teleport through the material plane at will, disappearing from one space and reappearing in another as easily as walking across a room. They can fire beams of energy that sap a creature's will and even humanity, or curse a creature to exist in an entirely other form, akin to a cloud of vapour.

entries.name: Constructed Nature
entries: A graven image doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Hoch Miraz wears a {@item ring of swimming} and a {@item ring of spell turning}. While wearing the latter, Hoch Miraz has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only him (not in an area of effect). In addition, if Hoch Miraz rolls a 20 for the save and the spell is 7th level or lower, the spell has no effect on him and instead targets the caster, using the slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the caster.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Hoch Miraz regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If Hoch Miraz takes fire or radiant daamge, this trait doesn't function at the start of Hoch Miraz's next turn. Hoch Miraz's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When Hoch Miraz's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a {@spell wish} spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Hoch Miraz is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Vengeful Tracker
entries: Hoch Miraz knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which he seeks revenge, even if the creature and Hoch Miraz are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by Hoch Miraz dies, Hock Miraz knows.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Hoch Miraz is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Hoch Miraz has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hoch Miraz makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which Hoch Miraz has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning daamge. Instead of dealing damage, Hoch Miraz can grapple the target (escape {@dc 11}) provided the target is Large or smaller.

action.name: Vengeful Glare
entries: Hoch Miraz targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until Hoch Miraz deals damage to it, or until the end of Hoch Miraz's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is {@condition frightened} of Hoch Miraz for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see Hoch Miraz, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success.

Hoch Miraz was a Calishite wizard looking to make his fortune in the mining industry on the island of Gundarlun. In around 1330 DR (more than a century and a half ago), Hoch Miraz was aboard the Golden Crown, a treasure vessel headed back from the mines of Berranzo, when a vicious storm struck the coast and sunk the ship.

Since the sahuagin have taken up host in the shipwreck, Hoch has been stirring in his watery grave. The mage is close to an undead reanimation, and he won't be happy to discover his {@item staff of the magi} missing.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: Hoch Miraz doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Being dead doesn't mean anything, once I have my staff back I'll work something out."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "My {@item staff of the magi} must be returned to me, without it I can't hope to rebuild my reputation."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "Once I decide on a plan of action, I cannot be swayed from it."

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sahuagin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its claws or spear.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) psychic damage. If the target is the same size or smaller than the sahuagin, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). The target must also succeed on a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the sahuagin. {@h}45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the sahuagin kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Illithid Hybrid Template
entries: A {@filter beast, humanoid, giant or monstrosity|bestiary|type=beast;humanoid;giant;monstrosity} can become an illithid hybrid. When a creature becomes an illithid hybrid, it retains all its statistics except as noted below.

entries.name: Senses
entries: The illithid hybrid gains {@sense darkvision} with a radius of 120 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: The illithid hybrid speaks Deep Speech in addition to any other languages it knows, and gains telepathy out to a range of 120 feet.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The illithid hybrid gains advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: New Action: Tentacles
entries: If the creature had a bite attack, it loses that attack. The illithid hybrid gains a tentacle attack with an attack bonus of the creature's Intelligence modifier + its proficiency bonus. The tentacles deal psychic damage equal to the illithid hybrid's Intelligence modifier plus additional psychic damage depending upon its size.

If the target is the same size or smaller than the illithid hybrid, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC equal to 10 + Strength modifier). The target must also succeed on a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the grapple ends.

entries.name: New Action: Extract Brain
entries: The illithid hybrid makes an attack roll with the same bonus as the Tentacles attack against one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid grappled by the illithid hybrid. The attack deals 5 × the damage dictated by the table above. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the illithid hybrid kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny eel. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The swarm can only breathe underwater.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Lightning eels are a variety of marine eel that can discharge an electronic shock when it attacks. They are rarely found alone when they are young, instead swarming together in packs. When an eel grows to giant size it leaves the swarm and finds a location to lair on its own.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merroni can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The merroni's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The merroni regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merroni's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The merroni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1e: {@spell armor of agathys|phb|armour of agathys} (5th level)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The merrow makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

If a merrow serves a powerful master with advanced spellcasting ability or great power, such as a demon lord, kraken or dragon turtle, they can pledge their souls to the creature to receive spellcasting abilities themselves. The merrow goes through a minor transformation; their eyes swell to many times their normal size, their jaws elongate, and their tongues fork. Once the transformation is complete, the merroni are distinct from their merrow kin, and gain potent spellcasting and magic enchantment. Other merrow join cabals and cults that serve the merroni, hoping to be gifted with a similar power by their arcane masters.

As if the merrow weren't bad enough already, now they have the ability to disappear before our very eyes, reappearing only to freeze us with magical ice. Old Tom from the Fisher's Float said he saw one conjure a tempest to sink a ship!

trait.name: Elder Brain Conduit
entries: While within 5 miles of Zellix-Phor, the elder brain can act through Druskis, and cast spells as if occupied Druskis' space.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Druskis has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h} The target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Druskis kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: Druskis magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Telepathic Reinforcement (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each creature of Druskis' choice that is within 120 feet of it, and is not already affected by the Telepathic Reinforcement gains advantage on attack rolls until the start of Druskis' next turn. Druskis can then make one attack as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Command Ally
entries: Druskis targets one ally within 120 feet of it. The ally can make one melee weapon attack using its reaction and has advantage on the attack.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
entries: When a creature Druskis can see targets it with an attack, Druskis chooses an ally within 5 feet of it. The two creatures swap places, and the chosen ally becomes the target instead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: Druskis is a 10th-level spellcaster, Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

entries: Primary attendant to Zellix'Phor, Druskis was tasked with accumulating knowledge of the Gith. They delighted in consuming the brains of the crèche leaders and using the information gained through consumption to locate every last Githyanki infant and slaughter them. Druskis is impatient and fastidious, only consuming fresh Gith brains if at all possible.

Despite their flaws, Druskis remains unquestionably loyal to Zellix'Phor and was instrumental in rescuing the elder brain from the crash site on Gundarlun. Druskis truly believes that without Zellix'Phor, the illithid empire will suffer a calamitous and irreparable loss.

Druskis has a special connection with the elder brain, and Zellix'Phor can act through Druskis's body when the two are close enough together. Through this connection, Druskis is able to lead the rest of the colony and its thralls in the exact way Zellix'Phor desires. Because of this connection, Druskis is also a master psion, capable of exterting great power over the Material Plane through their innate spellcasting.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: 'Zellix'Phor is the illithid's empire's greatest hope. They shall be protected at any cost.'

entries.name: Bond
entries: 'Druskis has a psychic connection with Zellix'Phor. Druskis is their favoured disciple, and will not permit any harm to befall them.'

entries.name: Flaw
entries: 'Druskis despises having to consume the brains of inferior races, only those of fresh Gith truly sustain Druskis. Endangering Druskis' supply of brains is a serious threat which cannot be ignored.'

entries.name: Mind Flayer Attendants
entries: The colony of Zellix'Phor consists of many mind flayers, but some of the most notable of the community have been promoted to the rank of attendant—illithds who unique strengths make them most useful to the elder brain, and who act as its council.

trait.name: Displacement
entries: Luzgrigaul projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while Luzgrigaul is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Luzgrigaul has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Psionic Augmentation
entries: Luzgrigaul has several augmentations that provide the following benefits:

items: Luzgrigaul can breathe normally in any environment (including a vacuum) and has advantage on saving throws against harmful gases (such as those created by a {@spell cloudkill} spell, a {@spell stinking cloud} spell, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons).
Luzgrigaul has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks that rely on sight.
Luzgrigaul's speed increases by 20 feet.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Luzgrigaul wears a {@item mind carapace breastplate|CallfromtheDeep} and wields a {@item mind lash|vgm}.

action.name: Mind Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage. Any creature that takes psychic damage from the mind lash must also succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h} The target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Luzgrigaul kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: Luzgrigaul magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: Luzgrigaul is a 10th-level spellcaster, Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

entries: Luzgrigaul despises humanoids, viewing them as truly inferior beings, from which nothing valuable can be learnt. If it were not for the diet of the illithid, Luzgrigaul would happily convert every living being into a mind flayer and incinerate the remnants of any inferior culture left behind. This contempt for those they consider lesser extends even to those within the colony. Whilst illithids truly belong to a hive mind, those closer to the elder brain are often more intelligent or have mastered greater knowledge, than those further detached, and to Luzgrigaul they are not worth a second look.

Luzgrigaul's area of expertise is the infusion of psionics and technology. They piloted the nautiloid and created magic items and augmented gear for the colony. Perhaps the most notable achievement of Luzgrigaul is the {@item psionic suit|CallfromtheDeep}, an enormous suit of armour powered by the mind, in which Luzgrigaul prefers to fight. Luzgrigaul is also responsible for the outfitting of thralls and slaves with augmentations such as {@item flensing claws|vgm} and {@item survival mantle|vgm|survival mantles}, which allow their servants to make it down to the illithid lair alive.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: 'Only through the fusion of psionics and technology will our great race survive.'

entries.name: Bond
entries: 'What remains of the nautiloid is essential for the survival of Zellix'Phor, Luzgrigaul will work tirelessly upon it until we can leave this wretched plane.'

entries.name: Flaw
entries: 'Any whose intellect Luzgrigaul deems inferior to my own is a waste of space.'

entries.name: Mind Flayer Attendants
entries: The colony of Zellix'Phor consists of many mind flayers, but some of the most notable of the community have been promoted to the rank of attendant—illithds who unique strengths make them most useful to the elder brain, and who act as its council.

trait.name: Combat Superiority (1/Turn)
entries: Tharcereli has a permanent bonus +2 to hit with its {@item mind blade greatsword|vgm|mind blade}.

Tharcereli deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a {@item mind blade greatsword|vgm|mind blade} attack. In addition, Tharcereli can choose one of the following optiosn ({@dc 15}):

items: {@i Disarm.} The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or drop an object of Tarcereli's choice that it's holding. The object lands at the target's feet.
{@i Menace.} The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of Tharcereli until the end of Tharcereli's next turn.
{@i Shove.} If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from Tharcereli.
{@i Trip.} If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocekd {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Tharcereli has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: Tharcereli rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, Tharcereli can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Tharcereli wears a {@item cloak of protection} and wields a {@item mind blade greatsword|vgm}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tharcereli makes three melee attacks: two with its {@item mind blade greatsword|vgm|mind blade} and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Mind Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d10 + 1}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h} The target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: Tharcereli magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 4d8 + 1}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Tharcereli adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, Tharcereli must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: Tharcereli's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

entries: Military statistician and determined warrior, Tharcereli is easily the most martially capable of the colony of Zellix'Phor. At the colony's height, Tharcereli would actively hunt down and spy upon the warlords of humanoid colonies, observing their behaviour on the battlefield and behind the closed doors of their war rooms. Only after observing the warlords for great lengths of time would Tharcereli finally emerge from the shadows and demand a duel.

Unlike most of their kind, Tharcereli longs for more than just a brain and the knowledge within, but for an epic clash of military mind and body. This, they assure the other mind flayers, flavours the brain of the defeated with the most delectable seasoning of emotions.

Tharcereli killed the head of the githyanki knights that attacked the nautiloid, but their hunger is insatiable. This lust for battle hides the fact that Tharcereli lacks the same psionic abilities of their peers. Whilst still able to emit a powerful psychic blast to stun their foes, they lack the ability to truly dominate their opponents, and cannot plane shift as other illithid can.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: 'Intellect is common to all of my kind. Mastery in battle is rare; Tharcereli is unique.'

entries.name: Bond
entries: 'The more foes Tharcereli can defeat, the stronger the colony will become. Their knowledge feeds our ambition.'

entries.name: Flaw
entries: 'Tharcereli's psionic abilities are underdeveloped; my martial prowess is a distraction, but these failings leave me vulnerable.'

entries.name: Mind Flayer Attendants
entries: The colony of Zellix'Phor consists of many mind flayers, but some of the most notable of the community have been promoted to the rank of attendant—illithds who unique strengths make them most useful to the elder brain, and who act as its council.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Tharcereli has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Virulent Host
entries: A creature that touches Thiliossk or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or contract a disease. Until the disease is cured, the target can't regain hit points, and the target's hit point maximum decreases by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) at the start of that creature's turns. If the target drops to 0 hit points as a result of this disease, the target dies and is reanimated as a {@filter mutant|bestiary|search=mutant|source=CallfromtheDeep} {@dice 1d4} rounds later.

action.name: Gas Canister
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d10}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or suffer one of the following effects:

items: {@i Poison.} The target is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect of a success.
{@i Madness (3/day).} The target deveops a {@table short-term madness|dmg} (see "{@variantrule Madness}" in chapter 8 of the {@i Dungeon Master's Guide}).
{@i Mutate (3/day).} The target is {@condition stunned} until the end of the next turn. Roll a {@dice d100|percentile dice} and consult the {@table Mutations Table|CallfromtheDeep}.
{@i Exhaust (3/day).} The target gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target gains 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by Thiliossk. {@h} The target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Thiliossk kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: Thiliossk magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: Thiliossk's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

footer.caption: Mutations Table
rows: The colour of the target's hair, eyes, and skin become blue, purple, pink, or patterned.
The target's eyes push out of its head at the end of stalks
The target's hands grow claws, which can be used as {@item dagger|phb|daggers}.
One of the target's legs grows longer than the other, reducing its walking speed by 10 feet
The target's eyes become beacons, filling a 15-foot cone with dim light when they are open.
A pair of leathery wings sprout from the target's back, granting it a flying speed of 30 feet
The target's ears tear free from its head and scurry away; the target is {@condition deafened}.
Two of the target's teeth turn into oversized, blunt tusks.
The target's skin becomes scabby, granting it a +1 bonus to AC but reducing its Charisma by 2 (to a minimum of 1)
The target's arms and legs swap, preventing the target from moving unless it crawls.
The target's arms become tentacles with fingers on the ends, increasing its reach by 5 feet.
The target's legs grow incredibly long and springy, increasing its walking speed by 10 feet.
The target grows a whip-like tail, which it can use as a {@item whip|phb}.
The target's eyes turn black, and it gains {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet.
The target swells, tripling its weight.
The target becomes skeletal, halving its weight.
The target's head doubles in size.
The target's ears become wings, giving it a flying speed of 5 feet.
The target's body becomes unusually brittle, causing the target to have vulnerability to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
The target grows another head, causing it to have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition stunned}.

entries: Arrogant and unfeeling, Thiliossk is a biological mastermind. They delight in zoological experimentation, capturing new species of humanoid and subjecting them to torturous trials, testing their thresholds for pain, strength and psionic ability. Most of the other illithid avoided Thiliossk's laboratory aboard the nautiloid, but the information they gathered in this abattoir is indispensable in the eyes of Zellix'Phor.

Illithid are never warm to each other, but Thiliossk brings this lack of empathy to new levels, never showing the slightest emotion, and savouring the brains of subjects that have been entirely broken through psychological and pshysical torture. On top of this, Thiliossk went first to protect their research after the crash, rather than the elder brain, which has pushed them to the bottom of the remaining hierarchy.

Thiliossk's responsibilities lie in the preservation of brains and other organs, specifically those of spellcasters, that can in turn protect Zellix'Phor from those who would do it harm. In addition, their biological research assists Luzgrigaul's psionic infusion technology, leading to better equipped thralls and slaves.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: 'Thiliossk does their best work when given the freedom to experiment.'

entries.name: Bond
entries: 'Thiliossk has important research that must be protected at all costs.'

entries.name: Flaw
entries: 'Thiliossk has no empathy. Emotions are chemical and hormonal. They belong to prey, not predator.'

entries.name: Mind Flayer Attendants
entries: The colony of Zellix'Phor consists of many mind flayers, but some of the most notable of the community have been promoted to the rank of attendant—illithds who unique strengths make them most useful to the elder brain, and who act as its council.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The monkey has advantage on all attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the monkey's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage.
Monkeys are cute little mammals adapted for a life in the canopy. These cheeky creatures can easily be tamed by humanoids who want an agile and comedic pet.

monster.name: Mutant (Type 1)
languages: understands the languages it knew in life, but can't speak

trait.name: Hideous Aspect
entries: Any creature other than a mutant that starts its turn within 5 feet of the mutant must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the mutant until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the hideous aspect of all mutants for 1 hour.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mutant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mutant Type
entries: The mutant has one of the following types:
{@b Type 1:} Swollen, red, protruding eyeballs.
{@b Type 2:} Leathery wings (50 ft. fly speed) and venom glands.
{@b Type 3:} Chitinous carapace (AC 20) and venom glands.
{@b Type 4:} Distended, dropping stomach and extended jaws.
{@b Type 5:} Extended jaws and a syringe-like stinger.
{@b Type 6:} Boils protruding from torso.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mutant makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sleep Gaze
entries: The mutant gazes at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target succumbs to a magical slumber, falling {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes or until someone uses an action to shake the target awake.
A creature that successfully saves against the effect is immune to this mutant's gaze for the next 24 hours. Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by it.

Some illithid communities attempt to better their thralls by augmenting them with psionic technology, or by kitting them out with magic items. Others take a more biological route, mutating their captives into hideous monstrosities with gangly, dragging limbs, extended jaws, or even tails and wings. These mutants bear a sickening resemblance to the creature they once were, a sight that is hideous to behold.
A creature transformed into a mutant has undergone a near-permanent alteration, and can only be restored by a {@spell wish} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The mutant makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the mutant, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the mutant's turns.

If the mutant takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the mutant must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the mutant. If the mutant dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stinger

trait.name: Acidic Boils
entries: Any creature that touches the mutant or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

In addition, when the mutant dies, it explodes in a burst of acid. Each creatuer within 10 feet of the mutant must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: Dhurge has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: Dhurge can breathe air and water, but he needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: Dhurge can magically command any shark within 120 feet of him, using a limited telepathy.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Callous carries a {@item wand of binding}, a {@item wand of fear}, a {@item wand of fireballs}, and a {@item wand of wonder}.

trait.name: Wand Wielder
entries: Dhurge counts as a spellcaster for the purpose of attuning to wands (spell save {@dc 15}). If Dhurge is carrying more than one wand, he can use an action to expend 1 charge from up to two wands, triggering the effects of them simultaneously.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dhurge makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

Sea devils are known for their ferocity, but not often for their magical prowess. Dhurge is an exception. Dhurge was born with the typical baron mutations (increased strength and extra limbs), but rather than fighting his way to the top of sahuagin society, as most barons do, Dhurge took a different route. While attacking a ship as a juvenile, Dhurge came across a {@item wand of fireballs} and quickly realised how to use the item. The power afforded to him by the item inspired him to search out more and more wands until he had a full set. By the time Dhurge was fully grown, he has discovered more wands than his hands could carry and had mastered their use. The arcane casting didn't go down well with the sahuagin of Kressilacc, Dhurge's home, so he headed south to the Nelanthers where he knew he could find work as a pirate. Here he was approached by Sea King Tentrix, who recruited him into the Black Armada.

Dhurge knows Tentrix must have a connection with the kraken, Slarkrethel. He has seen the kraken priests of Purple Rocks before and recognises the spellcasting he wields. He thinks highly of Tentrix, whose charismatic leadership has united dozens of crews under his command. Dhurge is a four-armed sahuagin with intelligent, beady eyes. He wields a wand in each hand, shooting spells at incredible speed. Dhurge wears a long wizard's robe that is always sodden and is covered in parts by a mossy seaweed.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "I collect wands; the more I have, the greater my power."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "Tentrix took me in when my culture rejected me. I'll protect him as best I can."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I can't resist the allure of a magic wand. A rare one would buy my loyalty."

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Jarl Bluebeard wields a {@item tentacle rod} and wears a {@item ring of swimming}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jarl Bluebeard makes two battleaxe attacks.

action.name: Tentacle Rod
entries: Each of the three tentacles on the rod attacks a creature: {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., up to three targets. {@h} 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage. If Jarl Bluebeard hits a target with all three tentacles, it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions for 1 minute. Moreover, on each of its turns, it can take either an action or a bonus action, but not both. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Beard {@recharge 5}
entries: The jarl swings his beard before him in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

Chief defender of Driftwood Docks, Jarl Bluebeard is a frost giant from Svardborg who joined the Black Armada after Jarl Storvald was killed by an adventuring party and the Ordning was restored. Looking for a way to please his god, Thrym, the raiding lifestyle promised by Tentrix to the giants caught his eye. Bluebeard's fanatical devotion to pleasing Thrym is not his only mark of insanity. The giant also insists on eating nothing but raw shark meat, weaving hammers into his beard, and hurling rocks at any ship not flying the flag of the Black Armada.

Despite serving the Sea King, Bluebeard knows little about Tentrix's true allegiances. He respects Tentrix simply because he upholds a life that Thrym would approve of; something not common in the small-folk. He knows that Tentrix is from Purple Rocks and that he has magical control over the ocean, but nothing more.

As the name suggests, Jarl Bluebeard has a bright, ice-blue beard into which he has braided half a dozen warhammers. Not used to the warmer climate of the Nelanthers, the Jarl tends to shun shirts, leaving his torso bare, save a few skulls from prized kills. The Jarl's nose is broken beyond repair and he has several giant runes tattooed across his forehead

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Thrym is the father of frost giants, I will prove myself worthy to be called his son."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "My alliance with Sea King Tentrix gives me the opportunity to raid and fight without him, I would be stuck in Svardborg."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "People sometimes call me insane. I kill them so the rumour doesn't spread."

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Tentrix can breathe air and water.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tentrix's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1e: {@spell armor of agathys|phb|armour of agathys} (3rd level)

action.name: Thunderous Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d10}) thunder damage.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Voice of the Kraken (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Slarkrethel speaks through Tentrix with a thunderous voice audible within 300 feet. Creatures of Tentrix's choice that can hear Slarkrethel's words ({@language Primordial|phb}) must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Handaxe
entries: Tentrix makes one handaxe attack.

legendary.name: Thunder Stride (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Tentrix teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet. Immediately after he disappears, a thunderous boom sounds, and each creature within 10 feet of the space he left must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Tentrix casts a spell from his list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

Hailing from Purple Rocks, Sea King Tentrix is a kraken priest working for Slarkrethel who has amassed the Black Armada. Tentrix coordinated the attacks on the Sword Coast after receiving a message from Slarkrethel, and eagerly awaits the rewards promised to him. Tentrix doesn't know that Slarkrethel has been replaced by Zellix'Phor, but knows the kraken lairs in Ascarle. Tentrix cares little for his life, believing the kraken can bring him back from death, but threats to his floating lair crack his stern exterior. If his lair is threatened he reveals information. Tentrix's link with Slarkrethel, and therefore Zellix'Phor, means the elder brain can use an action to deal 90 psychic damage to Tentrix, killing him instantly. Zellix'Phor does this if Tentrix is about to reveal the location of Ascarle.
Tentrix is brutal, brash, and uncaring. He's travelled across Faerûn and knows the its oceans like the back of his hand. He is arrogant, and believes himself undefeatable.

Tentrix is transformed beyond his human form. Tentacles that hang from his face like a twitching, fleshy beard. His eyes ooze ink down his face in staining streams. He wears a flowing leather overcoat and a tricorn hat. Tentrix is rarely seen without his familiar, a {@creature homunculus} named Filch.
{@i This is a lengthier description of Sea King Tentrix's background and personality, changed to the above in an update.}
oldEntries: Hailing from Ulf of Thuger on Trisk, the northernmost of the Purple Rocks, Sea King Tentrix is a kraken priest who works directly for the kraken, Slarkrethel. Since leaving Trisk, Tentrix has amassed a huge cult of followers, most of whom are pirates that serve on the Black Armada. Tentrix coordinated the attacks on the Sword Coast after receiving a telepathic message from Slarkrethel. Tentrix is excited to be taking the fight to the mainland and eagerly awaits the rewards promised to him by the kraken. Tentrix doesn't know that Slarkrethel has been replaced by Zellix'Phor, but he's aware of the Ruins of Ascarle, where Slarkrethel lairs.

Tentrix tries to keep his knowledge secret from everyone, never revealing the full story. Tentrix cares not for his own life, believing the kraken has the ability to bring him back from beyond the grave, but threats to his floating lair crack his stern exterior. If his lair is threatned, he begins to reveal information. Unfortunately, Tentrix's direct link with Slarkrethel, and therefore Zellix'Phor, means the kraken can use an action to deal 90 psychic damage to Tentrix, killing him instantly. Zellix'Phor does this if Tentrix is about to reveal the location of Ascarle.

Tentrix behaves as a pirate king; he is brutal, brash and uncaring. He has devoted his life to worshipping Slarkrethel, gaining a cutthroat reputation, and amassing the nastiest crew of pirate lords he could muster. He's travelled throughout Faerûn to these ends and knows the world's oceans like the back of his hand. Tentrix is inflated with importance, exceedingly arrogant and believes himself undefeatable.

Like most kraken priests, Tentrix has been transformed beyond his human form. He has a face of tentacles that hang down like a twitching, fleshy beard. His eyes ooze ink down his face in staining streams. He wears a flowing leather overcoat and a tricorn hat. Tentrix is rarely seen without his familiar, a {@creature homunculus} named Filch.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "I seek to bring glory to Slarkrethel, and in doing so become the deadliest pirate known to the Sword Coast."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "My crew are my kin. Mess with them and you mess with me."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "My reputation has gone to my head; I believe myself undefeatable."

from: {@item studded leather armor|phb|studded leather armour}, {@item arrow-catching shield}

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Storm Maiden can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Blessed by the Gods
entries: The Storm Maiden has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of damage when the Storm Maiden hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the Storm Maiden can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The Storm Maiden wields a {@item javelin of lightning} and wears an {@item arrow-catching shield}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Storm Maiden makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Javelin of Lightning
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Storm Maiden adds 3 to her AC against one melee attack that would hit her. To do so, the Storm Maiden must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Hailing from Rogarsheim of Norland in the Moonshae Isles, the Storm Maiden was once a feared battle leader. At the height of her power, however, she led a crazed quest to control the Sea of Swords that resulted in her ship vanishing beneath the waves. Blessed by {@deity Umberlee|Faerûnian|scag} and Valkur, the Storm Maiden somehow survived. It took many years for her to return, but she immediately stole a ship from a petty pirate captain and began amasing a new crew.

Although the Storm Maiden has no memory of her years under the waves, she remembers her defeat at the hands of the Tarnian White Sails Company and realised she needed a fleet of vessels to take revenge on Mintarn. After she has done so, she will return to Norland and claim the island for her own. Her mission quickly drew the attention of Sea King Tentrix, who offered her a position of command in the Black Armada should she help him enact his plans.
The Storm Maiden knows Tentrix is a Rocklander who venerates Slarkrethel, and believes she will be given command of the Black Armada to use after Tentrix is done.

The Storm Maiden appears as a young Norl woman with white hair and eyes that swirl with stormy blue and grey. She wields a javelin of lightning and carries an arrowcatching shield. She dresses in the usual attire of a Norl; leather armour and breeches with a fur cloak and horned helm. She is a proud woman who believes her blessings from {@deity Umberlee|Faerûnian|scag} and Valkur will guide her to victory

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "I will have revenge on Mintarn and claim Norland as my domain."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "Tentrix has promised me the Black Armada; I need his authority to take command of the fleet."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "My mood is like the sea, at times calm, at others tempestuous. Not even I can predict which it will be."

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ramazith is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Ramazith has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Ramazith wears a {@item pearl of power} on a necklace and a {@item ring of protection}.
Ramazith wields {@item Crest|CallfromtheDeep}, a {@item +1 dagger} with additional magic properties:

items: As a bonus action, Ramazith can cause a green stone set into the dagger's pommel to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, or make the stone go dark.
Whenever Ramazith starts his turn underwater with 0 hit points, the dagger causes him to rise 60 feet toward the surface.

action.name: Crest (+1 dagger)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pearl of Power (1/Day)
entries: Ramazith regains a spell slot of up to 3rd level.

Ramazith Flamesinger is powerful mage with an interest in marine life who lives in Baldur's Gate. His tower is easily recognisable in the city as it looks somewhat like a tiered lighthouse. Despite his age, Ramazith is a serial womanizer and a greedy old goat. Captains of fishing vessels often pay Ramazith a visit with exotic gifts in tow to ask about the movements of fish populations and dangerous predators of the deep.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "All knowledge is vital to someone, and we each have our speciality."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "The ocean calls out to me every day, I do my best to understand and protect it."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I can't resist a pretty face, even if it has a husband. I've got a soft spot for exotic treasures too."

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The reekmurk can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The reekmurk can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the reekmurk or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the reekmurk corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the reekmurk is destroyed after dealing damage.
The reekmurk can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the reekmurk must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all reekmurks for 1 hour.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The reekmurk takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armour worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armour is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

Reekmurks are underwater oozes normally found in the depths of frigid oceans. These creatures resemble massive oil slicks or clouds of ink. As well as a corrosive touch, these oozes emit a nauseating stench with suffuses the water surrounding them. Their main weakness is sunlight, which burns away at their amorphous forms. Rumour has it that reekmurks can grow large enough to sink ships and drown entire crew, though if this has ever happened, no one lived to verify the tale.

entries.name: Ooze Nature
entries: An ooze doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sahuagin can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Friend of the Sea
entries: The sahuagin can magically command any {@filter beast that has an innate swimming speed|bestiary|speed type=swim|type=beast} within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: The sahuagin is almost indistinguishable from a sea elf. A character that succeeds on a {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) check notices a slight difference in the eyes of the sahuagin that reveals its true nature.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The sahuagin deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the sahuagin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the sahuagin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

A sahuagin born near enough to an aquatic elf community can enter the world as a malenti–a sahuagin that physically resembles an aquatic elf in every way. Sahuagin are prone to mutation, but whether this rare phenomenon is a result of the wars between the sahuagin and the aquatic elves, or whether it preceded or even began the conflict, none can say.

The sahuagin put the malenti to good use as spies and assassins in aquatic elf cities and the societies of other creatures that pose a threat to sahuagin. The mere shadow of the malenti threat incites paranoia and suspicion among aquatic elves, whose resilience is weakened as the prelude to an actual sahuagin invasion.

There is little more terrifying than a malenti. To think that our greatest foe walks unnoticed among us is truly a waking nightmare. The resulting paranoia of such a threat has torn more than one of our communities apart.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sahuagin makes a Spit Poison attack. It then makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or net.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Net
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 5/15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

action.name: Spit Poison
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h}The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

If you think a sahuagin is a terrifying beast, be glad you've never met a raider, or ryethi, as they are known. These sea devils look similar to their un-mutated kin save for their red colouration, elongated claws, and the poison glands which hang down below their muscular throats.
A ryethi is capable of spitting a potent poison that is easily absorbed through humanoid skin. One mouthful of the bright orange poison is enough to knock a grown warrior unconscious.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sea cub can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The sea cub has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The sea cub has advantage on an attack roll against a cub if at least one of the sea cub's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Swimming Leap
entries: With a 10-foot swimming start, the sea cub can long jump out of or across the water up to 15 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage.

A sea lion is a fearsome monster with the head and forepaws of a lion and the lower body and tail of a fish. These creatures frequent temperate oceans and prey on anything from small fish to humanoids. These ferocious predators grow to a length of 15 feet and are highly territorial, attacking anything that trespasses on their hunting grounds with ire.
Baby sea lions are called sea cubs and are quite popular as pets among fishing communities. If trained properly, the sea cubs can serve as protectors of fishing boats when they grow up.
They're quite cute when they're young, but you won't like them when they're older, and they certainly won't let you dump them down the privy.

monster.name: Sea Spawn
languages: understands Aquan and Common but can't speak

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The sea spawn can breathe air and water, but needs to be submerged in the sea at least once a day for 1 minute to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sea spawn makes three attacks: two unarmed strikes and one with its Piscine Anatomy.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Piscine Anatomy
entries: The sea spawn has one or more of the following attack options, provided it has the appropriate anatomy:

items.name: Bite.
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

items.name: Coral Armour.
items.entry: The sea spawn increases its AC to 14.

items.name: Coral Club.
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Electric Lash.
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

items.name: Flash Lure {@recharge 4}.
items.entry: Each creature within 5 feet of the sea spawn that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the sea spawn's next turn.

items.name: Pincer.
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the sea spawn can't use its Pincer on another target.

items.name: Poison Quills.
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Secrete Poison.
items.entry: The next creature that hits the sea spawn takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

items.name: Sword Arm.
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

items.name: Tentacle.
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the sea spawn can't use this tentacle on another target.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The shoggoth can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Maddening Wailing
entries: The shoggoth emits a constant, hideous wailing. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the shoggoth and can hear the wailing must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw.

On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The shoggoth can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unfathomable Form
entries: When a creature that can see the shoggoht starts its turn within 30 feet of the shoggoth, it must make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. A creature that fails the saving throw is driven insane by the nightmarish form of the shoggoth, and suffers a {@table short-term madness|dmg} effect. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Unfathomable Form of all shoggoths for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shoggoth makes two tentacle attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}), and the shoggoth uses its Engulf on it.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The shoggoth engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the shoggoth's turns or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage. If the shoggoth moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The shoggoth can only have one creature engulfed at a time.

action.name: Gaseous Transformation
entries: The shoggoth transforms into acidic gas or reverts to its true form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is also transformed. It reverts back to its true form if it dies.

While in mist form, the shoggoth is {@condition incapacitated}. It has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can pass through any space that isn't airtight. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and is immune to nonmagical damage.

While in gas form, the shoggoth can enter a creature's space and stop there. Each time that creature starts its turn with the shoggoth in its space, the creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Borne of the malice of Elder Evils, a shoggoth is a manifestation of Far Realm insanity and unadulterated hatred.
